thread.title: Arizona signee to become first openly gay FBS scholarship player
thread.title_full: Arizona signee to become first openly gay FBS scholarship player

author: Joe Rodgers (joseph.rodgers@peformgroup.com)
title: Arizona signee to become first openly gay FBS scholarship player
text:
February 25, 2017 4:17pm EST February 25, 2017 4:17pm EST American Football, News, English, College Sports, NCAA Division I FBS, Arizona My-King Johnson will be the first openly gay scholarship athlete at an FBS school. Arizona football (Getty Images) 
Updated at 4:17 p.m. ET 
Updated at 4:17 p.m. ET 
When three-star defensive end My-King Johnson takes the field this fall for the University of Arizona he will be the first active openly gay scholarship player in major-college football history. 
In a feature with the Arizona Daily Star , Johnson told his family and friends he was gay since age 12 and found comfort in the fact the Arizona coaching staff is supportive of his choice. 
MORE: Candice Wiggins: I paid for being a straight woman in gay WNBA 
"They were the first Power 5 school to talk to me," Johnson told the Arizona Republic . "I just felt they showed they really wanted me." 
According to 247Sports , Johnson is the No. 53-ranked defensive end in the country. The 6-4, 225-pound Johnson recorded 21 1/2 sacks and three forced fumbles last season en route to All-Arizona honors. 
There have been a handful of college football players to come out as gay in division II, III and NAIA. Chip Sarafin was a walk-on at Arizona State but never played and Michael Sam, who announced he was gay to his teammates, didn't publicly come out until after college. 
Now it's Johnson's turn to be a trailblazer. 
"I do feel like when I say that, it can put a target on my back," Johnson said. "But whatever." Watch This
